title: Game Of Thrones Creators David Benioff And DB Weiss Are No Longer Working On Star Wars Trilogy
text:
When it was announced that Game of Thrones writers David Benioff and DB Weiss are working on Star Wars trilogy, they received a lot of backlash. Tagged the most disappointing season of all, Game of Thrones season 8 had just aired then and fans said they didn’t want them to ruin another epic project. They even started a change.org petition.

cdn.hypb.st

Months after the announcement, Game of Thrones creators David Benioff and DB Weiss have stepped down after exiting their deal with Lucasfilm to develop a new Star Wars trilogy.

The Star Wars trilogy was expected to follow the upcoming The Rise of Skywalker. The first instalment was expected to be out in 2022. Then what happened?

Apparently, the co-creators’ multi-year deal with Netflix became a hindrance. In a statement, they said, “We love 'Star Wars'. When George Lucas built it, he built us too. Getting to talk about 'Star Wars' with him and the current Star Wars team was the thrill of a lifetime, and we will always be indebted to the saga that changed everything.

But there are only so many hours in the day, and we felt we could not do justice to both Star Wars and our Netflix projects. So we are regretfully stepping away.”

Twitter

Lucasfilm president Kathleen Kennedy said the studio hopes to work with the two writers one day.

"David Benioff and Dan Weiss are incredible storytellers. We hope to include them in the journey forward when they are able to step away from their busy schedule to focus on Star Wars," she said.

With inputs from PTI
